intro: Hildmannia cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically ovate and covered in fine hairs. Hildmannia cumingii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
